nameOrigin.swaddle: to bind with strips of cloth
nameOrigin.cocoon: a pupal casing made by some insects

Swadloon.desc: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
Preferring dark, damp places, it spends the entire day eating fallen leaves that lie around it.
